reviewText: I have admired this Pulitzer Prize winning writer for years. It's fascinating to see what a true reporter will go through to get the story and then weave it into an article that will intrigue the reader. As the First Amendment is questioned and freedom of the press is being restricted with President elect Donald Trump, I feel it is an important documentary film to watch.
I had high hopes for this. I couldn't get into it, it felt dull. The content is worthwhile but the presentation is mediocre.

While oftentimes heartbreakig, also uplifting, hopeful and inspirational.
Also, a fascinating look at the life of a reporter and what they do to tell the story.

Nicholas Kristof is one of the top journalists of today, and this moving documentary conveys the dangers and challenges of his job with honesty and courage. Whether he is interviewing a warlord or survivors in a refugee camp in the Congo, Kristof interviews people with sensitivity, pragmatism and humor. Well shot, given the circumstances in the field.
